Select the operation (encrypt or decrypt), an alphabet and enter a key.
The key consists of exactly one character, that has to be contained in the selected alphabet.

context.title: Caesar
context.description:
The Caesar cipher is one of the simplest and most widely known encryption techniques. It is a classical type of substitution cipher in which each letter in the plaintext is replaced by a letter some fixed number of positions down the alphabet.
The Caesar cipher is named after Julius Caesar, who used it to communicate with his generals.
